As promised, here is a link to the slide deck that @rjones and I presented at Code for America last week: https://www.slideshare.net/tkuhrt/code-for-america-2018-using-hyperledger-technologies-to-deliver-government-services

We have been made aware of a REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) titled "Employee Digital Records" issued on behalf of the US Government Office of Personnel Management (OPM), Office of the Chief Information Officer (CIO) and the Office of Procurement Operations (OPO) - We encourage our community to reply to this RFI individually as appropriate. More information here https://www.fbo.gov/index?s=opportunity&mode=form&id=0246af87b41d04c95ac160e510c7218e&tab=core&_cview=0
 
We would also like to have a formal response from the Hyperledger Community to this RFI and to republish our response as a post to our public blog as an example of how one would use Hyperledger technologies to respond to an RFI/RFP like this as we believe we will be seeing more of these requests coming from government agencies. 
 
In order for us to reply, we are looking for a few volunteers to work together to respond as a community. Let Mpiekarska@linuxfoundation.org know if you'd like to work with us on the response.
 
Responses are due by June 13th.
 
Also, please note that you are also encouraged to attend this event tomorrow in DC
The US Office of Personnel Management (OPM), Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) is hosting an Industry Day for regarding this requirement for vendors this Thursday, June 7, 2018, from 9:30 AM to 10:30 AM (EST). This Industry Day will be held at OPM Headquarters, 1900 E Street, NW, Washington, DC 20415. See RFI link above for more info.

@marksta The purpose of the survey is to:
1. Understand the composition of the group
2. See what directions on the Agenda have the most interest and momentum
In order to determine the structure of the next set of meetings, as well as define work output priorities.
3. Get some momentum around the upcoming Hyperledger Global Summit - what does the group collectively wish to submit as a proposal
Would welcome your input to any of the above and/or you responses to the survey, which will be circulating out shortly.

Hi Bobbi, we really cannot make any fields manadatory, especially Personally Identifiable Information. People have the right to not share their address, email, etc. which is sensitive information and generally does not belong online. This is personal data, and people need control over it. Please remove all the mandatory fields, so we can move forward. Thanks much obliged.

This is a short Verifiable Organizations Network Primer document with a high level overview of our work https://docs.google.com/open?id=1Pfu7S1JtLFNDvxvZqRgN3rvQCnnWIZBi1Dth8pglUQ0

The deck covers Indy/Sovrin ledger details is "2018 - 07 - What Goes on the Ledger.pptx.gslides" https://docs.google.com/open?id=1WbTcnMpXh9vjMJrfNCDg2Kk-t7tT2wKhJE2-e8TYnJ4

Thanks folks .. have a great weekend.

Dear All in the Hyperledger Public Sector Working Group - 

Thanks for your participation in today's very informative call. We had 21 participants, some of which were groups, so it is heartening to see our community grow to encompass representation from all around the globe.

Special thanks to Bobbi Muscara, for pulling together these informative educational resources on explaining blockchain to lay audiences. Please note that these materials are in the mailing list and chat.

Also special Thanks to John Jordan and Olena Mitovska, from British Columbia and Ontario, Canada respectively. We enjoyed the overview of how province governments, along with the national government of Canada, are working together collaboratively to develop The Org Book - putting diverse, verifiable business credentials in an accessible format, undergirded by blockchain structure.

Anyone with additional questions for our presenters today, please share them here in our email digest, or in the group Rocket Chat. 

For our next call on Friday, August 17th:

We are looking forward to learning from Pete Teigen of IBM Global Business Services, who will share experiences with Hyperledger implementations in Delaware.

We also look forward to a group expertise sharing session with the UN in Uzbekistan, which is working on a land registration programme. (To be confirmed)

Request for support:
Would anyone on this group like to help us keep our Use Case wiki up to date? Every call we have a Zoom recording and slide presentations. It would be great if others could access the materials and learn after the fact by visiting our group wiki: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/groups/public-sector-wg/public-sector-wg

Please let me know if you'd be willing to help with this important documentation support.

Thanks and best wishes for the weekend to all!

Rose

Has joined the channel.

Suggestion for the Agenda next week:
IBM will not develop Hyperledger Composer any further. There will be something similar in the fabric core.
When I asked someone of the composer Team about that, he told me
```
see the email https://lists.hyperledger.org/g/composer/message/125 - IBM is refactoring its approach - ie bringing all that was good in Composer, into Fabric native - so that there is less confusion on how to move forward with development. They will factor some of the Contract API / SDK changes (for Node JS initially) into Fabric 1.3, then in Fabric 1.4, the plan is to work on Java/Go enhancements - so that developers can them choose a diferent language to develop, but importantly, the same framework (which wasn't the case before)
```

What level of government is “local”. One thing to consider is identifying what is the “foundational” credential. In our case we are working with the business registry. One could imagine land parcels as foundational. As well, legislated member organizations like lawyers, doctors, nurses, engineers. Greetings,

My name is Pat and I am preparing to write a thesis in computer science starting one year from now. I have not finalized a thesis topic. However, I am interested in documenting a set of regression and machine learning techniques for analyzing Hyperledger transactions. Granted the nature of the transactions will demand different types of analysis but I am most interested in doing this from a blockchain perspective.

I am not experienced with Hyperledger or blockchain technology yet. I plan to prepare for the thesis over the next year by learning Hyperledger. Are there any large public Hyperledger transaction data sets that I can access with permission from the owning organization in exchange for an ongoing analysis of the data? A not-for-profit organization would be ideal but I welcome the input if you know where I can access a large data set. Thank you for your input.

Hi everyone. My name is Sergei Smalkov. I am product manager at Blockchain Industrial Alliance, a blockchain startup in the industrial and government sectors. We have been working on ethereum based platform for the governments of Russia and Uzbekistan. So far we've build a sort of google engine cloud platform for DApps. Modified ethereum to meet nationwide governmental hi load needs of up to 10000 tps, hybrid onchain-offchain data storage and other. We have already tested some dApp in real life cases in the public sector.  Some of them are: transparent voting for the municipal initiatives, smart city, drugs certification, blockchain voting as a service. Currently we are working on the dApp for blockchain diploma certificates. We have done a lot so far, but never shared the insights. Since we are building blockchain as a service systems with prebuilt ready to deploy apps, we are interested in good challenging cases as well. Is there a way to participate at one of the collaborative activities or meetings to first share probably some valuable insights, and get an unbiased feedback from this group? How we could participate and what could be the most valuable way to share? Thank you!

Hi everyone. My name is Sergei Smalkov. I am a product manager at Blockchain Industrial Alliance, a small blockchain startup in the industrial and government sectors. We have been working on ethereum based platform for the governments of Russia and Uzbekistan. So far we've built a sort of google engine cloud platform for DApps and Modified ethereum to meet nationwide governmental hi load needs of up to 10000 tps, hybrid onchain-offchain data storage and other. We have already tested some dApp in real-life cases in the public sector.  Some of them are transparent voting for the municipal initiatives, smart city, drugs certification, blockchain voting as a service. Currently, we are working on the dApp for blockchain diploma certificates. Since we are building blockchain as a service system with prebuilt ready to deploy apps, we are interested in good challenging cases as well. Is there a way to participate in one of the collaborative activities or meetings to first share probably some valuable insights, and get unbiased feedback from this group? How we could participate and what could be the most valuable way to share? Thank you!

Hi everyone. My name is Sergei Smalkov. I am a product manager at Blockchain Industrial Alliance, a small blockchain startup in the industrial and government sectors. We have been working on ethereum based platform for the governments of Russia and Uzbekistan. So far we've built a sort of google engine cloud platform for DApps and Modified ethereum to meet nationwide governmental hi load needs of up to 10000 tps, hybrid onchain-offchain data storage and other.We have already tested some dApp in real-life cases in the public sector.  Some of them are transparent voting for the municipal initiatives, smart city, drugs certification, blockchain voting as a service. Currently, we are working on the dApp for blockchain diploma certificates. Since we are building blockchain as a service system with prebuilt ready to deploy apps, we are interested in good challenging cases as well. Is there a way to participate in one of the collaborative activities or meetings to first share probably some valuable insights, and get unbiased feedback from this group? How we could participate and what could be the most valuable way to share? Thank you!
